[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Type parameter K] [Generic misuse] Can different instantiations of MockTreeStore<K> with incompatible K types be mixed, causing type confusion and incorrect node decoding? (Medium)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Type parameter K] [Phantom data] Does Node<K> properly use PhantomData<K> if K is not stored directly, or can incorrect variance annotations break type safety? (Low)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Mock usage] [Production deployment] Can MockTreeStore accidentally be used in production instead of the real StateMerkleDb, disabling critical persistence and causing total data loss on restart? (Critical)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Mock usage] [Test assumptions] Do tests relying on MockTreeStore make assumptions about ordering or behavior that don't hold in the production StateMerkleDb, hiding bugs until deployment? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Mock usage] [Performance mismatch] Does MockTreeStore's in-memory HashMap have vastly different performance characteristics than production storage, causing tests to pass but production to fail under load? (Medium)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Mock usage] [Missing features] Does MockTreeStore implement all TreeReader/TreeWriter methods that production code uses, or can missing methods cause runtime errors when switching from mock to production? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Edge case] [Empty tree] Can operations on an empty MockTreeStore (no nodes) cause panics or undefined behavior in get_rightmost_leaf() or purge_stale_nodes()? (Medium)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Edge case] [Single node] Does storing a single root node work correctly, or can edge cases in get_rightmost_leaf() fail when there's only one leaf? (Low)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Edge case] [Version 0] Can version 0 nodes be stored correctly, or do zero-version edge cases cause off-by-one errors in version comparisons? (Medium)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Edge case] [Max version] Can Version::MAX nodes be stored and pruned correctly, or does version overflow cause arithmetic errors in stale_since_version calculations? (Medium)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Edge case] [Empty batch] Can write_node_batch() and write_tree_update_batch() handle empty batches gracefully, or do empty iterators cause unexpected behavior? (Low)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Edge case] [Identical nodes] Can two nodes with identical content but different NodeKeys be stored, or does HashMap equality checking incorrectly deduplicate them? (Medium)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Integration] [TreeReader trait] Does get_node_option() fully implement the TreeReader contract expected by JellyfishMerkleTree, or can missing guarantees break Merkle tree operations? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Integration] [TreeWriter trait] Does write_node_batch() provide the atomicity guarantees that TreeWriter consumers expect, or can partial failures violate those contracts? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Integration] [NodeBatch type] Is NodeBatch just a type alias for HashMap, or does it have additional structure that MockTreeStore doesn't validate? (Medium)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Integration] [Version semantics] Does MockTreeStore's version handling match the semantics expected by the Merkle tree library, particularly for versioned queries and proofs? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Concurrency] [Read lock starvation] Can continuous write operations in write_node_batch() starve readers in get_node_option(), preventing Merkle proof generation and causing API timeouts? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Concurrency] [Write lock fairness] Does RwLock guarantee fair lock acquisition, or can a malicious thread repeatedly acquire write locks, blocking all other operations indefinitely? (Medium)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Concurrency] [Lock upgrade deadlock] Can attempts to upgrade from read to write lock (even if not directly in the code) cause deadlocks in surrounding code that uses MockTreeStore? (Low)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Concurrency] [Concurrent purge] Can multiple concurrent purge_stale_nodes() calls with different min_readable_version values cause race conditions where nodes are deleted out of order? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Data integrity] [Node hash verification] Does MockTreeStore verify that inserted nodes have correct hash values matching their content, or can corrupted nodes with mismatched hashes be stored? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Data integrity] [Parent-child consistency] Does MockTreeStore validate that child nodes referenced by Internal nodes actually exist in the store, or can dangling references break tree traversal? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Data integrity] [Nibble path validation] Does MockTreeStore validate that NodeKey nibble paths are well-formed and don't exceed ROOT_NIBBLE_HEIGHT, or can malformed paths corrupt indexing? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Data integrity] [Leaf key matching] Does MockTreeStore verify that LeafNode account keys match their NodeKey hash, or can mismatched keys break Merkle proof verification? (High)

[File: storage/jellyfish-merkle/src/mock_tree_store.rs] [Memory optimization] [Arc sharing] Should Node<K> use Arc for internal sharing to reduce clone overhead, or does the current clone() implementation unnecessarily duplicate large subtrees? (Medium)
